NAME [POSTION TITLE [BIRTHDATE (fo, Day, Yr)
Davidson, Jeffrey Mark Protessor of Pathology 114/46

"EDUCATION (Begin with baccalaureate or other nila professional education, such as nursing, and Include postdoctoral aning)

YEAR
INSTITUTION AND LOCATION DEGREE CONFERRED FIELD OF STUDY

Tutts University BS. 1967 Biology
Stanford University MA, 1969 Biol. Sciences
Stanford University Pho. 1975 Biol. Sciences

 

 

 

 

RESEARCH AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Conclading wih present posilion, lit, in chronological order, previous employ=
‘ment, experience, and honors. Include present membership on any Federal Government advisory committe. List, in chronological
‘tder, the tiles and complete references to all publications during the past three years and to representative earlier publications
Pertinent to this application. 00 NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.

Research and Professional Experlence:

1969-1971 _ Biological Sciences Assistant, 6th U.S. Army Medical Laboratory, Fort Baker and Fort Ord,
California

1973-1978 Senior Fellow, Department of Biochemistry, University of Washington, Seattle, Washington

1978-1981 Senior Staff Fellow, Pulmonary Branch, National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute, Bethesda,
Maryland

1981-1983 Associate Chief, Ciinical Chemistry, Veterans Administration Medical Center, Salt Lake City,
Utah

1981-1983 Assistant Professor, University of Utah School of Medicine, Salt Lake City, Utah

1983-1984 Associate Chief for Research, Laboratory Service, Veterans Administration Medical Center,
Salt Lake City, Utah

1983-1985 Associate Professor of Pathology, University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah

1984-1985 Associate Research Career Scientist, Veterans Administration Medical Center, Salt Lake City,
Utah

1984-1985 Associate Research Career Scientist, Research Chemist (GS-13), Veterans Administration
Medical Center, Salt Lake City, Utah

1986-1987 Associate Professor of Pathology, Department of Pathology, Vanderbilt University School of
Medicine, Nashville, Tennessee

1987-1990 Ad Hoc Reviewer, Site Reviewer, NIH Pathobiochemistry Study Section

1990-1994 Member, NIH Reviewers Reserve

1987-1991 Career Development Committee, Department of Veterans Affairs

1986-Pres. Associate Research Career Scientist (GS14), Veternas Administration Medical Center,
Nashville, Tennessee

1988-Pres. Professor of Pathology, Department of Pathology, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine,
Nashville, Tennessee

 

Publications (Selected):

1. Yoon,K., Davidson, J.M., Boyd, C., May, M., LuValle, P., Ornstein-Goldstein N., Smith, J, Indik, Z., Ross,
‘A, Golub, E., Rosenbloom, J. Analysis of the 3° region of the sheep elastin gene. Arch. Biochem.
Biophys. 241:684-691, 1985.

2. Sephel, G.C., Davidson, J.M. Regulation of elastin synthesis in organ and cell culture. Meth. Enzymol,
LW. Cunningham, Ed., 144:214-292, 1987,

3. Sephen, G.C., Buckley, A., Davidson, J.M. Developmental initiation of elastin gene expression in human
skin fibroblasts. J, Invest, Dermatol, 88:732-735, 1987,
